# Quarto resources 

## Tutorials and how-to 

### Merging Python, R and Observable 

How to merge various engines in one notebook: https://gist.github.com/hrbrmstr/23355194d1964688596553a0e6a0050a 

The secret is to declare the language in code such as: 

::: {.cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
print('Hello python')
bla = {'x_values': [0,1,2,3,4], 'y_values': [10,11,12,10,9]}
ojs_define(bla=bla)
print(bla)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Hello python
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
DeprecationWarning:

Importing display from IPython.core.display is deprecated since IPython 7.14, please import from IPython display

```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
```{=html}
<script type="ojs-define">{"contents": [{"name": "bla", "value": {"x_values": [0, 1, 2, 3, 4], "y_values": [10, 11, 12, 10, 9]}}]}</script>
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
{'x_values': [0, 1, 2, 3, 4], 'y_values': [10, 11, 12, 10, 9]}
```
:::
:::


```{ojs}
Inputs.table(bla)
```

```{ojs}
console.log('hello observable js')
Plot.dot(bla, {x: "x_values", y: "y_values"}).plot()
```
